intro: Clidemia novemnervia var. affinis, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in forest understories and is an important component of native Hawaiian ecosystems. However, it is also considered an invasive species in some regions outside its native range.
